content: You are an information extraction assistant.

Generate one fictional wikipedia style paragraph that contains at least 6 sentences and describes one or more following relation types: "member of sports team", "position held", "member of", "employer", "educated at", "spouse”. The content of this generated fictional wikipedia style paragraph can be the description of a famous individual, military force, melodious song, renowned club, political party, captivating book, opera, video game, film, TV serie, remarkable country, mesmerizing artwork, distinguished organization or influential company in the world. Provide them in JSON format with just following keys: title, context.

Extract the entities in your above generated document. Provide them in List of JSON format with the following keys: entity, entity type. The entity type can be one of the following types: "Organization", "Location", "Time", "Person", "Miscellaneous", "Number", "Blank".

```json
[
	{"entity": "John Smith", "entity type": "Person"},
	{"entity": "New York Knicks", "entity type": "Organization"},
	{"entity": "NBA", "entity type": "Organization"},
	{"entity": "Chicago", "entity type": "Location"},
	{"entity": "University of California", "entity type": "Organization"},
	{"entity": "Los Angeles Lakers", "entity type": "Organization"},
	{"entity": "Jessica Johnson", "entity type": "Person"}
]
```

Present the relational triplets as (one head entity, one tail entity, one relation type), if a relationship exists between two entities. The relation type can be one or more of following relation types: "head of government", " country", " place of birth", " place of death", " father", " mother", " spouse", " country of citizenship", " continent", " instance of", " head of state", " capital", " official language", " position held", " child", " author", " member of sports team", " director", " screenwriter", " educated at", " composer", " member of political party", " employer", " founded by", " league", " publisher", " owned by", " located in the administrative territorial entity", " operator", " religion", " contains administrative territorial entity", " follows", " followed by", " headquarters location", " cast member", " producer", " award received", " creator", " parent taxon", " ethnic group", " performer", " manufacturer", " developer", " series", " sister city", " legislative body", " basin country", " located in or next to body of water", " military branch", " record label", " production company", " location", " subclass of", " subsidiary", " part of", " original language of work", " platform", " mouth of the watercourse", " original network", " member of", " chairperson", " country of origin", " has part", " residence", " date of birth", " date of death", " inception", " dissolved, abolished or demolished", " publication date", " start time", " end time", " point in time", " conflict", " characters", " lyrics by", " located on terrain feature", " participant", " influenced by", " location of formation", " parent organization", " notable work", " separated from", " narrative location", " work location", " applies to jurisdiction", " product or material produced", " unemployment rate", " territory claimed by", " participant of", " replaces", " replaced by", " capital of", " languages spoken, written or signed", " present in work", " sibling”.

```json
[
	{"head entity": "John Smith", "tail entity": "New York Knicks", "relation type": "member of sports team"},
	{"head entity": "John Smith", "tail entity": "University of California", "relation type": "educated at"},
	{"head entity": "John Smith", "tail entity": "Los Angeles Lakers", "relation type": "member of sports team"},
	{"head entity": "John Smith", "tail entity": "Jessica Johnson", "relation type": "spouse"}
]
```
Present reasoning explannation of each relational triplet.

1. John Smith is a "member of sports team" New York Knicks: This triplet indicates that John Smith was associated with the New York Knicks basketball team, implying that he played for the team during his professional basketball career.

2. John Smith was "educated at" University of California: This triplet suggests that John Smith received his education at the University of California, indicating that he attended the university and likely played college basketball there as well.

3. John Smith is a "member of sports team" Los Angeles Lakers: This triplet signifies that John Smith was part of the Los Angeles Lakers basketball team, indicating that he played for the team at some point in his career after his time with the New York Knicks.

4. John Smith is "spouse" of Jessica Johnson: This triplet reveals that John Smith is married to Jessica Johnson, indicating that they are partners in a marital relationship.
Present support sentence index for each extracted relational triple that shown in your generated document.

```json
[
	{"head entity": "John Smith", "tail entity": "New York Knicks", "relation type": "member of sports team", "support sentence index": 1},
	{"head entity": "John Smith", "tail entity": "University of California", "relation type": "educated at", "support sentence index": 2},
	{"head entity": "John Smith", "tail entity": "Los Angeles Lakers", "relation type": "member of sports team", "support sentence index": 3},
	{"head entity": "John Smith", "tail entity": "Jessica Johnson", "relation type": "spouse", "support sentence index": 4}
]
```

Organize the above triplet information in List of JSON format with the following keys: head entity, tail entity, relation type, reasoning explannation of each relational triplet, index of supporting sentence that shown in document,

```json
[
	{
		"head entity": "John Smith",
		"tail entity": "New York Knicks",
		"relation type": "member of sports team",
		"reasoning explanation": "John Smith was associated with the New York Knicks basketball team, implying that he played for the team during his professional basketball career.",
		"supporting sentence index": 1
	},
	{
		"head entity": "John Smith",
		"tail entity": "University of California",
		"relation type": "educated at",
		"reasoning explanation": "John Smith received his education at the University of California, indicating that he attended the university and likely played college basketball there as well.",
		"supporting sentence index": 2
	},
	{
		"head entity": "John Smith",
		"tail entity": "Los Angeles Lakers",
		"relation type": "member of sports team",
		"reasoning explanation": "John Smith was part of the Los Angeles Lakers basketball team, indicating that he played for the team at some point in his career after his time with the New York Knicks.",
		"supporting sentence index": 3
	},
	{
		"head entity": "John Smith",
		"tail entity": "Jessica Johnson",
		"relation type": "spouse",
		"reasoning explanation": "John Smith is married to Jessica Johnson, indicating that they are partners in a marital relationship.",
		"supporting sentence index": 4
	}
]
```
